quest.name: Into a Copper Hell
journal: Momodi is waiting to brief you on your task.

It would seem that a horde of hecatoncheires has been wreaking havoc in the depths of Copperbell Mines. So that mining operations may resume, Papashan bids you subdue the hulking creatures. In preparation for the mission, the stationmaster suggests that you speak with Painted Mesa, an employee of Amajina & Sons Mineral Concern.

You learn from Painted Mesa that Copperbell Mines were reopened in order to meet the pressing demand for building materials created in the wake of the Calamity. Without a steady supply, Ul'dah's nascent recovery may slow to a standstill. Make your way to the mines, and report to the Stone Torch who stands guard at the entrance.

You've been granted permission to enter the mines. Make your way through the tunnels, putting down any hecatoncheires you encounter.

※Challenge Copperbell Mines with other players via the Duty Finder, or with a party of NPCs via Duty Support. Both systems are accessible from the main menu as well as the dungeon's entrance point.
You have succeeded in subduing the hecatoncheires. Report back to Painted Mesa at the Quicksand.

Your conversation with Painted Mesa is cut short by a shrill cry. Rushing to the origin of the exclamation, you find a woman being harassed by ruffians, and hurl yourself in harm's way to protect her. Immediately thereafter, Y'shtola arrivesYda and Papalymo arriveThancred arrivesHildibrand, the bumbling inspector of legend, arrives on the scene.

After praising your courage, Y'shtola reveals that she belongsYda and Papalymo reveal that they belongThancred reveals that he belongsthe pair reveal that they belong to an order called the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, and invites you to join theminvite you to join them. But who exactly are these Scions, and what is their agenda? Perhaps Momodi can shed some light on these questions.

In the course of your travels, you have crossed paths with myriad individuals, some of whom you have positively influenced. One such individual is the young conjurer Edda, who reveals that you have inspired her to embark upon a new journey as an adventurer. You sense that you, too, must soon embark upon a new journey of your own. Speak with Momodi again when you have resolved to take the first step.
objectives: Speak with the Stone Torch before Copperbell Mines.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: The petitioner ought to be arrivin' any moment now...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Gods almighty! Another second under that sun, and I would have been set afire! A tankard of ale, if you would be so kind!

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Excellent timin', Papashan. It just so happens the adventurer who'll be handlin' your petition is here.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Oh? Why, if it isn't my good friend Forename!

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: It does my spirit well to know that you are the one who will be helping us.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: So this winsome lassstrapping young lad is the much-lauded adventurer, is shehe? Marvelous, marvelous!

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: A pleasure to make your acquaintance, miladygood sir. I am Papashan, formerly of the Sultansworn. I thank you for agreeing to lend us your aid.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Mayhap you'd like to apprise Forename of herhis mission?

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Yes, of course. The petition in question was submitted by an acquaintance of mine at Amajina & Sons Mineral Concern. It relates to an unfortunate development at Copperbell Mines.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: To be plain, giants have seized control of the place.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: These giants are of the clan known as the hecatoncheires─fearsome creatures who were sealed within the deepest depths of the mines during the bygone Thorne Dynasty.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Alas, it seems they have managed to break through the layer of rock which served to imprison them, and now prowl the tunnels where the miners ply their trade. The creatures are justifiably angry about their treatment at the hands of our ancestors, and their presence has forced the suspension of all mining activities on the site.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: It's no wonder they're angry. Didn't the Thorne Dynasty come to an end over three hundred years ago?

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: You know your history well, milady.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: The people of that age used the hecatoncheires to work their mines. By way of enchanted helms, they were able to bind the ferocious creatures to their will. But as is oft the way in such tales, these enchantments eventually failed, and the slaves rose up against their masters.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: In a desperate bid to contain the unbridled fury of the hecatoncheires, our ancestors induced the collapse of the mines' lowermost levels. So it was that the Great Giant Revolt was ended─buried beneath a hundred thousand tonzes of rock.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Well, now...that's got me thinkin'... I seem to recall there bein' an article about Copperbell in the Mythril Eye a fortnight or so ago.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: It said the mines were bein' reopened so as to meet the risin' demand for buildin' materials. Like as not, our boys dug a bit too deep and freed the giants.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Gods...to think the poor creatures are still alive an' kickin' after three centuries... That's a long time to nurse a grudge. They must be seethin'...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Indeed. And that makes them a danger to us all. There will be no mining at Copperbell so long as they remain. For the sake of both peace and prosperity, they must be subdued. This is the task which we would have you undertake.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Indeed. And that makes them a danger to us all. There will be no mining at Copperbell so long as they remain. For the sake of both peace and prosperity, they must be subdued. This is the task which we would have you undertake.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: I'll not deny that the mission will be rife with danger, but our need is great. And so I beg you: put an end to this sorry business.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Gods bless you! I feared you might have reservations, but I assure you it is for the best.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Hmmm... In case you don't know, Copperbell Mines are in western Thanalan. Do take care, you hear?

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Ah, and one last thing before you depart... An employee of Amajina & Sons is presently at the Quicksand. The fellow's name is Painted Mesa, and he knows Copperbell Mines well. It may behoove you to seek his counsel.

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: Lookin' for Painted Mesa? You found him.

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: So you're the adventurer who's volunteered to deal with the mess down in Copperbell, are you?

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: You've got guts, missmate. I just hope you've got skills to go with 'em, 'cause things ain't pretty down there. The hecatoncheires've left the place in a right state, and nary a week after minin' resumed.

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: I don't know if you know this, but Copperbell was old when the second Ul Dynasty was still young, and it was abandoned centuries ago. If it hadn't been for the shortage of materials needed for the rebuildin' effort, the Concern would never have thought to reopen it.

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: We knew full well about the giants beforehand, but the project went ahead anyway. I mean, nothin' could possibly survive bein' buried under a mountain's worth of rock for three centuries, right? Wrong!

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: Our miners dug up more than they bargained for. One swing of the pickaxe too many, and they found 'emselves in the company of giants. Unless we can subdue 'em, the nation's glorious recovery'll grind to a halt for want of aught to build with.

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: The Stone Torches're keepin' watch over the entrance in case the giants fancy some sunlight and fresh air. One of 'em will be able to show you the way in. The hope of the nation's restin' on you, friend. Best of luck!

dialogue.name: STONETORCH
dialogue.text: There's been an incident inside Copperbell Mines. We are here to ensure that its effects are contained, but for your own safety, I suggest you stay well away from here.

dialogue.name: STONETORCH
dialogue.text: What? You're the adventurer who's volunteered to quell the hecatoncheires?

dialogue.name: STONETORCH
dialogue.text: I didn't think that Papashan would be able to find someone so quickly...if at all.

dialogue.name: STONETORCH
dialogue.text: The giants are content to wreak havoc inside the mines for now, but it's only a matter of time before they think to come outside. The sooner you see to them, the better. Make ready as best you can, and enter at will.

dialogue.name: ISILDAURE
dialogue.text: I have been an adventurer for long years, and borne witness to many a pivotal moment in history. Though the times may have changed, the essence of our trade has not.

dialogue.name: ISILDAURE
dialogue.text: Adventuring has ever been a quest for self-betterment through challenges freely faced, and ever shall it remain so.

dialogue.name: ISILDAURE
dialogue.text: As an adventurer becomes more experienced, he will naturally acquire a love of justice, and an understanding of the spirit of self-sacrifice.

dialogue.name: ISILDAURE
dialogue.text: Such experience cannot be measured in any tangible way, yet it most assuredly shapes who we are, grounded as it is in the decisions we have made on our journey, and their consequences, good or ill.

dialogue.name: ISILDAURE
dialogue.text: I sense a light within you, young one, and it tells me that you are destined for greatness.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: We found Dolorous Bear and his entire party dead. The giants were...thorough in their work.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: Judging by their tracks, it would seem they tried to rush a horde of the creatures. I cannot say for sure what drove an experienced crew like theirs to throw caution to the wind...but I do have my suspicions.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: We are all our own worst critics, and our desire to better past achievements can rob us of good sense. Thus do we become more given to recklessness.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: While it is important to have goals, one must not fixate upon them to the exclusion of all else. Do so, and one will surely pay the price, as Dolorous Bear and his comrades did this day.

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: The hope of the nation's restin' on your shoulders, friend. Send them giants back to whichever of the seven hells they escaped from!

dialogue.name: STONETORCH
dialogue.text: Good luck in there, adventurer. We Stone Torches will continue our vigil here, lest the foe slip by you.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“Into a Copper Hell”?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: Ah, the conqueror of Copperbell returns!

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: Thanks to you, our minin' operations can resume, and Ul'dah will have the materials she needs to rebuild. The entire nation's in your debt, friend.

dialogue.name: PAINTEDMESA
dialogue.text: I'll share the good tidin's with Papashan the next time I see him. As for you, you'll want to report to Momodi. It'll do the woman well to see you alive and in one piece.

dialogue.name: POORDRESS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Noooooo!

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)Shut your mouth, you thieving little swine! You stole from me─don't even think to deny it!

dialogue.name: POORDRESS
dialogue.text: P-Please, sir, I didn't steal nothin'!

dialogue.name: POORDRESS
dialogue.text: I b-bought this─paid for it with me own coin!

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)What rot! You refugees are all the same─couldn't afford maggoty mole meat, much less a choice cut of dodo!

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)I'm going to say it one more time: give back what you stole, or I'll make you wish you'd never set foot in this town!

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)By rights, I should turn you over to the Brass Blades, you know─help keep the streets safe for law-abiding citizens. But I'm a reasonable man. If you agree to serve me in...whatever capacity I require, the authorities needn't hear of your crime.

dialogue.name: POORDRESS
dialogue.text: B-But I ain't done nothin' wrong! Twelve as me witness!

dialogue.name: POORDRESS
dialogue.text: P-Please, adventurer! Help me, I beg o' ye!

dialogue.name: POORDRESS
dialogue.text: I swear on me mother's grave, I didn't steal nothin'! I bought this with the coin I'd saved... <sob> I only wanted to treat me children to a decent meal...

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)And who the hells are you when you're at home!? This dog's master?

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)I've had enough of this mummer's farce. You lot, teach them a lesson!

dialogue.name: HEAVY
dialogue.text: I ain't gettin' paid enough for this!

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)H-Hey! Where the hells do you think you're going!?

dialogue.name: POORDRESS
dialogue.text: Thank ye, kind adventurer! Thank ye thrice over!

dialogue.name: YOUNGULD
dialogue.text: I'd swear there were more refugees than when I last looked...

dialogue.name: RESTLESSULD
dialogue.text: And you wouldn't be mistaken.

dialogue.name: YOUNGULD
dialogue.text: But it's been five years since the Calamity! Why are they only coming here now?

dialogue.name: RESTLESSULD
dialogue.text: It's simple, really─while a number of hamlets survived the immediate aftermath of the Calamity, many were no longer able to support their communities.

dialogue.name: RESTLESSULD
dialogue.text: The residents found their lands had either been rendered barren, or cut off from trade routes─and problems like those aren't easily solved. Though they tried to make the best of it, it was only a matter of time before they were forced to abandon their homes and seek a new life in the city.

dialogue.name: YOUNGULD
dialogue.text: I see...

dialogue.name: YOUNGULD
dialogue.text: But the Calamity affected the whole realm, didn't it? Is the same thing happening in the other cities?

dialogue.name: RESTLESSULD
dialogue.text: If the talk is true, yes.

dialogue.name: RESTLESSULD
dialogue.text: Though perhaps our situation is more pronounced. Ul'dah has a reputation for being prosperous, so it's natural that the refugees would try their luck here first.

dialogue.name: YOUNGULD
dialogue.text: My heart goes out to them, it truly does...but I would be lying if I said that I wasn't apprehensive. I hope their presence doesn't foment lawlessness in the city.

dialogue.name: RESTLESSULD
dialogue.text: Well, if things do take a turn for the worse, we always have the Immortal Flames. I daresay the Brass Blades would welcome their help.

dialogue.name: YOUNGULD
dialogue.text: The heroes who fought the Garlean Empire, patrolling the streets for riffraff?

dialogue.name: RESTLESSULD
dialogue.text: It may well come to that.

dialogue.name: RESTLESSULD
dialogue.text: Impoverished and desperate as they are, you may be sure that some of the refugees will turn to crime.

dialogue.name: RESTLESSULD
dialogue.text: You know what this place is like. If you've no coin, you've no hope.

dialogue.name: YOUNGULD
dialogue.text: <sigh> What will become of our city?

dialogue.name: RESTLESSULD
dialogue.text: Not all refugees are bad, mind you. Some are able to find employment and lead honest lives.

dialogue.name: SALESPITCH
dialogue.text: Dodo tenderloins! Get yer dodo tenderloins! Guaranteed cheapest in Thanalan!

dialogue.name: SALESPITCH
dialogue.text: Thank ye for yer custom, madam! Please come again!

dialogue.name: YOUNGULD
dialogue.text: Looking around, you'd think that Ul'dah was well on its way to recovery.

dialogue.name: YOUNGULD
dialogue.text: But peer through the veil of prosperity and you'll see no end to the misery and suffering.

dialogue.name: POORDRESS
dialogue.text: Er...madamsir? Are ye all right?

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)Wh-What now!? You mean to threaten a defenseless citizen!?

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)...What? Saw her buy that meat, you say? Th-That's absurd!

dialogue.name: AGENT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Aye, as did I! Leave the poor woman alone, you damnable vulture!

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)Wh-Who said that!?

dialogue.name: UNGUST
dialogue.text: (-Obnoxious Merchant-)Grrr! I will overlook this...but just this once!

dialogue.name: POORDRESS
dialogue.text: Gods bless ye, adventurer! If ye hadn't come along when ye did, who knows what that monster might've done!? It don't bear thinkin' about...

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Case closed!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Hello again!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: We have been keeping a close eye on you ever since you left Gridania.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: You discharged your duty as envoy impeccably, and never once faltered in the face of myriad dangers.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: But more importantly, you were always ready to help those in need, even if you didn't stand to earn a gil by doing so!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: You are possessed of all the qualities we seek in an adventurer, of this we are convinced.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Even if you were kind of dragged into that business with the dodo meat.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Yes, thank you, Yda. Ahem. And then there is the matter of your gift. I daresay you are curious as to the nature of the vision you bore witness to moments ago? Well, we can help you to understand it.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: You're not the only one with that power, you know. We have a friend who has it too, and we'd love for you to meet her.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: And meeting her is only the beginning, for we would also have you lend your strength to our cause. In return, we should be glad to assist your adventuring endeavors in whatever way we are able.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Should you decide to take us up on our offer─and I sincerely hope you will─pray speak with Momodi. The proprietress of the Quicksand is a good friend of ours. She will tell you where to find us.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Waaait a minute─we haven't even told you the name of our order! We're the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, defenders of justice! Oh, but don't tell anyone. Except for Momodi. She knows already.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Ever the selfless hero, I see.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It has been a while, adventurer.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I have been watching you closely ever since you flew out of Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You discharged your duty as the Admiral's personal envoy with admirable humility, and you have displayed unfaltering courage in the face of danger ever since.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Whensoever you came upon those in need, you gave them succor with no thought of personal gain.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: In summary, you have demonstrated all of the qualities we seek in an adventurer.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: For reasons I cannot well explain, your every deed seems invariably to serve the general good...whether you mean it to or not. It is a happy knack, and one which speaks volumes for your character!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Yet for all your admirable qualities, it is your gift which intrigues me most. I speak of the visions you experience. Visions like the one you had mere moments ago, if I am not mistaken. I can provide you with the means to understand them.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: An acquaintance of mine is blessed with the selfsame talent, you see... If you so desire, I can introduce you to her. She and I fight for a common cause─a cause which would greatly benefit for your support.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If you would agree to lend us your strength, we should be glad to do all within our power to aid you in your personal endeavors.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Think on my offer awhile. Should you decide to accept it, pray speak with Momodi. The proprietress of the Quicksand is a close friend and ally of ours.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Inform her that you have been chosen by the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, and she will tell you where to find us.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: (-???-)All's well that ends well!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We meet again!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Pray do not mistake my intent─for it is always honorable─but I have been watching you ever since you departed Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You played the part of envoy to perfection─confident as a womanman on a diplomatic mission should be, yet unfailingly courteous to your betters. And when your travels led you into the midst of danger, you faced it without so much as a flinch. You, my ladyfriend, are quite a marvel, and I confess to being quite taken withsomewhat in awe of you!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, but my lavish praise continues. Most of all, I was struck by your readiness to aid those in need, even when words were all the reward you could expect to receive. Such selflessness is a rare thing in this day and age.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...All of which leads me to conclude that you are indeed the one whom I have been looking for─an adventurer possessed of a very rare set of qualities.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: To be sure, your rescue of that damsel in distress was more of a happy accident. But rescue her you did, and that is what matters in the end.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I feel I should mention at this point that I also harbor a burning interest in a certain talent of yours. I speak of your visions. You have been experiencing visions, have you not?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Well, it just so happens that I know a woman who shares your talent, and can help you to understand it. She and I belong to the same organization, and we should both be delighted beyond words if you would agree to join our cause.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Naturally, there are benefits to being part of such a collective. For one, we should be glad to assist you in realizing your potential as an adventurer.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You need not give me your answer now. Think upon it, and if you feel moved to help us─as I pray you shall─speak with Momodi, the ever-lovely and youthful mistress of the Quicksand.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Tell her the Scions of the Seventh Dawn have found their womanman, and she will tell you where to find us.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Hmph. Scenes like that are becomin' ever more common, I'm afraid. Don't worry, though─if you work hard, you'll probably be all right.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Sayin' that, if you ever find yourself in a spot of bother, come and see me. Just don't go pesterin' me every time you graze your knee, eh?

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: ...'Course, I do enjoy hearin' tell of a gentleman's woes with the womenfolk from time to time...

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Sorry to keep you waitin'─I was just providin' guidance to a fresh-off-the-carriage adventurer.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: But gods, it's good to see you safe and well! To look at you, no one would ever guess you'd been hard at it with giants in the dark!

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: I never doubted for a moment that you'd succeed, of course, and neither did Papashan─which ain't to say he won't be overjoyed!

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: You're every ilm the adventurer Miounne said you'd be, Forename. The stationmaster will be overjoyed when he hears the news!

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Oh, before I forget, there's a lass here who wants a word with you. Didn't actually know your name, but hearin' her description, I knew who she meant right away.

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: Th-Thank you for sparing the time. I realize you don't know me, but I've been longing to speak with you for a while now.

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: My name is Edda. I'm an adventurer like you, though I'm not very good at being one, if truth be told. Anyway, I was adventuring with my friends in Gridania when...when... I-I'm sorry. We were in Gridania...when the leader of our party was killed.

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: His name was Avere, and he and I were to be wed in the spring. You may not remember him, but to say that he remembered you would be an understatement. He would sing your praises from dawn to dusk. He saw you for what you are, you see─an adventurer's adventurer─and swore that he would be like you one day.

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: I believe that he would have succeeded...had a fiend not robbed him of the chance. Since that day, I have thought long and hard about giving up adventuring.

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: But when I think of the womanman you are─of all that you've achieved─I find that I am inspired, just as Avere once was.

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: And so I've decided to start again as an adventurer. I will go back to the village of my birth and begin my training anew.

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: But I wanted to meet you first...to ask you your name.

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: Forename Surname... I shan't forget.

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename Surname. I pray that we will meet again. Fare you well!

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Adventurin' can be a cruel bleedin' business... Time was, I didn't know why anyone would bother. When they first asked me to take charge of the guild here, I didn't want aught to do with you lot─thought it'd be a right pain in the arse lookin' after you all.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: But against my better judgment, I decided to accept the post...and I'm full glad I did. I feel privileged to be a part of your lives.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: And that goes double for yours, Forename!

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: ...Eh? What did you say? You want to know about the Scions of the Seventh Dawn?

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: They're beginnin' to move in earnest, then...

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Listen, Forename─the Scions ain't no ordinary folk, and the work they do ain't no ordinary work. I know full well how capable you are, but even you would think twice about attemptin' some of the stuff they do. Knowin' that, if you're still certain you want to get involved, I'll tell you what I can.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: <belch> I'll take care o' this. The rest o' ye can watch.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hmph! Not bad...for an adventurer!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ugh... I should've stopped at the seventh ale...

dialogue.name: QIB
